title: Language Learning Research Design Utilizing Eye-Tracking Technology

context.prior_knowledge: Basic understanding of research methodologies and linguistics
context.additional_context: Course for language professionals to learn integrating eye-tracking technology into research design, conducted via microlearning using personal devices in BYOD settings

learning_goals: Learners can explain the principles of eye-tracking technology and its applicability to research.
Learners can propose at least three eye-tracking experimental designs suitable for language learning research.
Learners can establish a logical predictive framework connecting theoretical backgrounds with eye-tracking data.
Learners can analyze and evaluate real research cases through case-based learning and write reports.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
